headline: Easy Broccoli Quiche
description: This vegetarian broccoli quiche with onion, garlic, and mozzarella cheese is a snap to make in a prepared pie crust. It looks great on the table!

video.description: You won’t believe how easy, and delicious, this vegetarian quiche is.
video.name: Easy Broccoli Quiche

name: Easy Broccoli Quiche

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add broccoli, onion, and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are soft. Spoon vegetables into pie crust and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese; set quiche on a baking sheet.
Combine eggs and milk together in a bowl; season with salt and pepper. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon melted butter; pour egg mixture over vegetables.
Bake in preheated oven until the center of the quiche has set, about 30 to 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Use less milk and more eggs
Delicious with an Allrecipes pie crust!
I thought the recipe was very easy to follow. And the result is amazing.
Easy and came out perfect! I added mushrooms and sweet peppers and used soya milk instead of cows milk.
It was very yummy!! I wrote down the recipe to use again.
I loved making the quiche. I included crab , half and half milk, and included less broccoli.
I make this at least once a month. Use phyllo crust and it turns out delicious every time.
Very easy to make. I also added some fresh cherry tomatoes to add some color and freshness to the veggies. Family and friends love it.

I wish I would have gone with my instincts and skipped this recipe. I am kicking myself because I know the basic rules of quiche, including that you should pre-bake your crust. This just didn’t work at all for me. It was so liquidy and didn’t cook fully (I exceeded the cooking time after it didn’t set at 45 minutes). I see a lot of comments now about major tweaks made. I went on the ratings themselves and should have dug deeper. Read up on basic guidelines to creating a good quiche and skip this one.
Great soup recipe. You won’t need the pie crust, Just a bowl and spoon if you put that much milk in the quiche. Beware
I followed directions - except I added small drained can of mushrooms. It was a little wet...will decrease the milk next time. After set up about 10" it was delicious.

I wanted to add o my previous review that I always bake my pies at 450 in oven for 15 minutes then turn down to bake at normal temp for remaining baking time. This ensures that the middle is cooked. I learned this from my ex mother in law who owned a bakery who used this method for her berry pies and I only used a half of a small onion.

loved it
used 3 eggs instead of 4, 1 cup of milk instead of 1 and 1/2 cup . Had too much liquid otherwise.
This is my favorite quiche recipe. I slightly reduced the amount of veggies & milk, added sauteed onion & garlic. I omit the salt & pepper since I just add it when I eat it anyway.
Great recipe, I used my duck eggs and added mushrooms and just a small pinch of freshly grated nutmeg. It got a thumbs up from hubby. This is a keeper.

I love this recipe - full of flavour I like the mozzarella cheese instead of Swiss or cheddar - I make it twice a month and vacuum seal and freeze to take to euro for lunches - use a toaster oven to reheat - best
I have made this recipe several times and always enjoy it. Today I added approx 1/4 C diced fried bacon. This added just another layer of flavor and was delicious!
Easy to make. Turned out very good.

We enjoyed this quiche. When I saw chopping 2 cups of broccoli was needed I just pulled out the food processor. With a couple of pulses 3/4 of a head of broccoli was chopped perfectly. I had 1/2 of an onion in the frig so I used that. If I had mozz cheese I might have used it but didn't so used 2 slices of havarti and 2 slices of provolone. Bake time was about 50 minutes. This made a nice 9" pie. I'll keep this recipe. I made my own crust---Perfect Pie Crust recipe.

The proportions are way off. There is enough mixture for two 9" pie shells. I baked mine for an hour and it didn't set completely, and I didn't use all of the mixture. I would try the recipe again, but would use two shells. Would probably cook faster, but at least it would cook completely!
I left a review about how soggy it is in the middle. I just pulled it out again, after probably 60 Minutes putting it back in the oven. Still very watery! A little frustrating!
EXCELLENT. We omitted the onions (since our daughter hates them) and this is honestly one of the best quiches I've ever had.
Fabulous! I had to bake it for 50 minutes for it to set, but it is really good! If I were to make one change, it would be to reduce the salt slightly. But slightly.

As written, it makes 2 quiches. I was trying to pour all the ingredients in one quiche and the pie crust wasn't having it, which was super annoying trying to salvage what was already in there into another pie crust. Taste was ok... I wouldn't make it again.

The broccoli seemed a bit soggy. I wonder if I should put it in raw next time. I will also try the trick I read in a review about putting some cheese in the crust first so that the crust doesn't get soggy. This was good but not great! Needed a little more flavor as well.

Absolutely delicious! I seared the brocoli whole first, and then added water to boil it down, slowly adding the onions etc. I broke up the brocoli with a sharp spatula while ont he skillet. Very good!!
Small onion. Perhaps a couple drops of hot sauce
I added mushrooms. It was delicious

Super easy! I added bacon and did half mozzarella / half Mex blend, cuz it's what I had onhand. It took about 45 min in my oven & probably would've been done sooner if I didn't keep opening the door!!
I thought the flavor was fantastic and my picky teenager ate it without comment (which means he liked it). I like how versatile this can be--next time maybe ham & Swiss w/spinach ! Thanks for a great week night dinner
Not much prep and delicious!

Super easy and turned out great. I used two frozen pie crusts as they were labeled as deep dish, but they weren’t. Also, I had frozen broccoli instead of fresh (because quarantine) so I sautéed the veggies longer to get the excess liquid out. Really tasty!

Great, easy recipe. It's hard to go wrong with quiche. My edits included less onion (3/4 onion) and more broccoli (1 crown chopped). I also followed advice of top rated review and packed the cheese onto the pie shell instead of sprinkling. I expected the quiche to turn out on the wetter side, which it did. Next time I will reduce milk and add another egg. Delicious!

There was WAY too much milk in this recipe. I had to cook it for 75 MINUTES and the result was a soggy crust and barely edible quiche. Thank goodness for a roll and ice cream. Do yourself a favor and find another recipe or try making it without one.
Delish!

ugh. too much milk. this thing has been in the oven for 45 minutes and it is still completely wet without any signs of setting! I'm so disappointed. cut the milk down in half! I wish I had read people's reviews before making so I could avoid this problem, as now I'm seeing it was a common one. phooey.

I made this twice, once exactly as written and another time using different cheese and asparagus instead of broccoli. Both times the quiche was great. When prepared according to the recipe it was fluffier and more moist. The other time I used a variety of cheeses I had on hand and the quiche turned of more firm and a bit saltier, but not too salty. I was delicious both ways, but I think I prefer it with the other cheeses.

I wish I'd read the reviews about adding the cheese first to prevent soggy crust. Still didn't turn out too bad.
100% agree, never use frozen broccoli ladies and gentlemen!

As in every recipe I've ever made for quiche, way too much egg/milk mixture! I would do as another reviewer said, use 5 eggs and at the most 1 cup of milk...even 4 eggs and 1 cup milk would work I'm sure.
I used a half a sweet onion. 1 whole cooking onion would be too strong imho.
I also added more garlic and next time I will use far more broccoli. It tends to shrink a little when you cook it in the pan and I'd want it to come right up to the tip top of my crust! 
The nice thing is, you can adapt this and add ham, mushrooms or whatever you like.
Way too many egg batter leftover unless using deep dish pan. I saved it for eggs for breakfast and I used seasoning salt in veggie mix and kosher salt in egg batter.

I made these in 6 ramekins and stretched Pillsbury crescent roll dough with a rolling pin to form crusts in each, except for mine, which I made with no crust (because I can’t have gluten and didn’t want to bother making a gluten free crust). Done in about 40 minutes in my convection oven set at 350 degrees F. Easy and delicious!

I've made this quiche over a dozen times now and I feel confident to review it. I use a basic 9 inch pie pan and the filling this recipe gives is way too much for my pan. After my first attempt, I learnt to use half the ingredients for a good quiche. I love veggies, so I add zucchini in addition to the broccoli and the result is amazing! I'm also not a big fan of cheese, so end up using less than half the amount recommended, but I'm yet to get a bad review on the quiche. It's wholesome and so yummy, guests always come back for seconds and go looking for third helpings. I cut a star only because my first attempt got burned due to all the extra filling. Try this recipe, you won't regret it!
so bad! no flavor and like a soup! super watery. I was SO disappointed! Don't bother
Love this recipe! Works like a charm. I added some spinach to it, too. More veggies the better!
Maybe it's just my oven, but I have to cook it for 1 hour to get doneness in the middle.
Broc on!! followed it to the letter...great!

I like to give most recipes a first try "as-is", so I didn't alter much on this, just added bacon, because bacon makes everything better! Overall, I thought it turned out pretty good, but I would make a few adjustments next time....LESS onion (1/4-1/2 an onion), less milk! It was completely overflowing my deep dish pie crust and took 45 minutes to bake, and even then, I think it could have been in a bit longer. I took the advice of another and put some cheese on the bottom and sides of the crust to help not get soggy - which I would recommend everyone does. I also wouldn't cheat this with frozen broccoli, I used fresh and it was moist, so can't imagine with frozen. Enjoy!
Made this for supper and loved it! Didn’t have mozzarella but used cheddar instead nor did I have garlic so put in an extra green onion. Will definitely make this wonderful quiche again!
It was very tasty, my husband loved it and the two of us ate it all in 24 hours!

I loved this recipe. I took a shortcut by adding garlic powder instead of fresh garlic and substituted cheddar for mozzarella. I had to work with what I had. There was too much egg mixture so there was some left over. Best tasting quiche I have made myself and it was quick and easy.
No changes. The recipe is fabulous as is. I'll definitely make it again. ??

This is the second time I make this quiche. I really love this recipe. It is a great base. I used fresh spinach this time instead of broccoli and it turned out amazing! You really do need to use a deep dish pie crust for this recipe. I definitely could make this quiche every week. Thank for sharing recipe
delish!!
This was delicious ! Easy to make ! I added a bit of spinach as well.
Made it for two neighbors and the three of us sat outside, socially distanced, of course. It was a great hit! They both loved it and I enjoyed the leftovers even more!!!

Made it with a few changes. Instead of an onion, used a shallot. For the cheese I used half cheddar and half Swiss. Instead of milk I used light cream. Left out the salt. It was really tasty and will be great as leftovers for a quick dinner!
I added parmesan and swiss cheese because I didn't believe that the mozzarella would deliver the depth of flavor a quiche deserves.

I did make a few changes, used 2 green onions and a little red onion, 1c milk 1/2 c whipping cream, 1c mozzarella 1/2 c mixed Mexican cheese and a sprinkle of paprika. Baked 55 minutes. Family loved it! I will make if again.

Made exactly as described. It was bland, I think it could be improved with a sharper cheese, like cheddar, and more pepper. It was way too much egg/milk mixture, it overflowed the deep dish pan. Wish I would have read the reviews first regarding the soggy crust
Made some changes, 3 eggs, 1/2 cup milk, added cheddar cheese and Italian seasoning. Turned out great! It’s a keeper!
I reduce the amount of milk to 1 cup so it doesn’t over flow the SDRO dish pie shells I buy.

This really was easy! But I had crescent rolls and a toaster oven so I had to make some changes. I used an oval dish lined with A square of 2 rolls with seam pressed together. I steamed my broccoli under plastic wrap in my microwave and used the entire head, so I added an egg to the wet mix. I was able to make four of the dishes, baked 2 at a time, and then 6 cupcakes lined with 2 wonton wrappers each...so this made 5 meals for me (froze the cupcakes)! I let the edges get to the point of almost burnt to be sure the bottoms were done and I had put a layer of shredded cheese in the bottom to try and keep it from getting soggy. Plus more cheese on top of course (mozz and cheddar)

In these quiche recipes you call for 1 (9inch) pie crust. I followed the recipe and when I put it in the oven the egg mixture ran out of the pie crust.
It should have read: 1 (9 inch) DEEP dish pie crust. Thankfully I put a cookie tray under the pie to catch drippings!!!!!!

I've made this quiche several times & always a winner! I add cauliflower with the broccoli, don't bother in sautéing the veggies, just make sure the pieces are small & same size. I ALWAYS ADD 3 extra eggs as we LOVE our eggs. Delicious, delicious !
Excellent! Can also include cauliflower!! I added a dash of basil as well!

Most of the 4 & 5 star ratings have major modifications!!!! The recipe ended up needing 2 deep dish pie crusts. I used 2c fresh broccoli & 1/2 an onion. It was still wet... cut back the milk. Needed the full 50min for bake time.

This was "ok". A large pie plate is needed (more like a fruit pie plate) as the ingredients ran over and the cooking time needs to be a little longer so it won't be under-cooked in the center. I don't see this as a five-star and there are other recipes that are far better than this one.

With any recipe on ALLRECIPES, I always read thru many reviews. I don't want to waste time making a dish that doesn't taste good to my liking or is a complete flop. So, sometimes I'll tweak it based upon other's experiences to avoid this.

WHAT I LIKED: This quiche is simple, easy, and can be used as a good "base" to switch out the veggies/meat/cheese type. For this, I used broccoli, onion, both cheddar & Italian blend shredded cheese.

WHAT I CHANGED: I didn't use melted butter. I used 1 cup fat free half/half. I used 1/4 large white onion. I used 6 large eggs. 

PREPARATION: I did what other reviewers suggested, I baked cheese in the bottom of piecrust (frozen crust shell) to keep the bottom firm. I cooked the onion, veggies, butter, garlic in pot until soft. In the other bowl I beat the eggs very fluffy, added garlic salt, dash of salt/pepper, bacon crumbles, and cheese. Then I combined the veggies to the egg mixture and stirred. I noticed the batter was nice & thick, so didn't worry about cooked consistency. I filled the pie shell to top. Placed on cookie sheet just in case it dripped over.

COOK TIME: I baked at 350 for 45 mins. Let completely cool on stovetop. Placed onto cake plates to serve.

REVIEW: This quiche turned our perfect! It's fluffy, flavorful and looks good. I'll be using this exact method next time alternating the veggies!

As other reviews point out, this is too watery. I followed the recipe as written, but it never set. I cooked it for 60 minutes and the top browned, but as the image shows, when I removed 4 pieces, enough liquid remained to fill in the missing places 1" deep. Several guests refused to eat it, but I made my boys eat it. The taste is fine, but 1 onion is pretty strong.
Good recipe. I switched mozzarella cheese to cheddar cheese

I substituted chopped cauliflower for broccoli and added 1/4 lb. sausage for added flavor. Salt and/or pepper to taste. Used half & half for milk and only needed 1/2 cup. A delicious way to enjoy cauliflower. Used lots of onion, garlic & cheese as I do for many recipes. Yum!

I used a combination of extra sharp and monterey pepperjack cheese in place of the mozzarella. Will make this dish again, however, I'm going to use a little bigger pie plate as it started to spill over as it baked. I put a cookie sheet under it so I wouldn't have a baked on mess in the oven to deal with.
Really heavy. Cheese too bland.sorry
I used frozen broccoli- thawed it and chopped it up. Added some Fresh Mozzarella cheese and a bit of shredded colby jack to color up the top. Added small slices of grape tomatoes. Yummy!

I’ll pretend the recipe called for 1/2 cup milk and almost 1/2 cup evaporated milk. 1 1/2 cups milk I thought was way too much. I used 5 eggs and a full smaller onion. I put cheese on top and the bottom and poured egg mixture on top. My kids both loved it!

This was a delicious quiche recipe! My 7 year old loved it! Because quiche is so versatile, I opted to use fresh (not frozen) baby spinach in place of the broccoli. I also added about 1/4 cup or less of crumbled turkey sausage (cooked) for a heartier dish. I baked it for 40 min, but had to pop it back in the oven for an additional 10 min because it was really runny. I will still make this in the future and it was still delicious, but even after a total of 50 min, the bottom was very watery. Thanks for sharing a delicious recipe overall!
Perfect as is!

I've made this several times with various vegetables. I'm familiar enough with the basic ratios of ingredients that I can adjust the needed liquids to match variations in veggie size and amounts and how they cook down. That means that this is a forgiving recipe that's hard to mess up.
This recipe was very easy to make ! Thank you
Turned out great! DELICIOUS!
I prebaked the crust and then added the cheese before the filling and the crust stayed crisp. Tasted great!
I made this as is. (I bought a pre-made pie crust and defrosted for 15, baked for 15 covered in foil) and then assembled the quiche. It was yummy and a big hit.
A lovely quiche, I've been able to easily swap out the broccoli for other vegetables with great results if I feel like changing things up.
Would add bacon or ham and bake it in a deep 9inch pie crust. I had a bit of extra batter left. Was a hit. Kids liked it. Will make it again.
It was easy and very tasty.
I made this quiche but changed the cheese to gruyere instead of Monterey. It was delicious.
The only changes I made to this recipe were to use Monterey Jack cheese and to bake it at 360 degrees (for 45 minutes). I was very happy with this, as was my fiancé, who rated it 8 out of 10!

I did make some adjustments per previous reviews...2 1/3 cups broccoli, about 2/3 c onion, ~1T garlic, 1c milk, 3 eggs, 1T Montreal chicken seasoning . Pressed in cheddar “cheese raincoat” first, spread veggies, top with more handfuls of cheddar, poured eggs and milk, baked at 350° for 50 minutes.
It’s absolutely delicious but it took a full hour to cook through. Next time I think I’ll add one more egg and half the milk.
Really easy and awesome tasting. (I added some Black Forest Ham to mine.)
So delicious - everyone in my family absolutely loved it!
So delicious - everyone in my family absolutely loved it!
Turned out great. Used deep dish crust and only 1c milk and half an onion. Also took 60min to bake and have firm middle.
I added broccoli and bacon, but no need to, I just had them at hand. Delicious recipe.

We loved this. We went Keto with it and did not include the crust and added bacon and spinach. No issue with wetness as the fresh broccoli was cooked in a wok under high heat (which tends to dry it out). We also used the bacon grease instead of butter. Lovely bacon flavor throughout. And we carmelized the onions under low heat before adding the broccoli. This mellowed the onions and added some sweetness to the dish. Net (for the whole pie) 1760 calories of which 920 were from fat.

I topped it with pepperoni!!
It is delicious ??
So easy. I used a frozen pie shell and it turned out perfect!
I added 1/2 cup premium chunk chicken. This recipe would be good with about 1/4 of the onion. A whole onion is way too much.
Simply delicious!

So yummy!!! I had everything in my fridge but the cheese, so I used what I had...havarti...and that was perfect! I added a bit of nutmeg to the egg mixture and a few shakes of Cholula hot sauce. Baked until just set and let it sit for about 5 minutes before diving in. It's a good thing I'm the only one home so nobody can see what huge bites I'm taking. You won't regret making this one!

The only change I made was adding leftover ham that I had on hand. I used a very small onion and baked it for 50 minutes. I love quiche so I was very happy with it. My husband, who claims he does NOT like quiche, ate about half the pie!
